intro: Actephila dolichantha, commonly known as the long-stalked actephila, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
